abstract: Government lawyers withdraw their opposition to new trial for Ingmar Guandique, man serving 60 years for 2001 killing of Washington intern Chandra Levy, making it likely that trial will proceed.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for the man, Imgmar Guandique, had sought a retrial because they said a key witness in the case, his onetime cellmate, gave false or misleading testimony during his 2010 trial.

headline.main: New Trial Likely for Man Convicted of Intern’s Death
headline.print_headline: New Trial Likely For Man Convicted of Intern’s Death

snippet: Lawyers for the man, Imgmar Guandique, had sought a retrial because they said a key witness in the case, his onetime cellmate, gave false or misleading testimony during his 2010 trial.
